name: py-ipython

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependencies.name: py-appnope
dependencies.description: Disable App Nap on OS X 10.9

dependencies.name: py-backcall
dependencies.description: Specifications for callback functions passed in to an API

dependencies.name: py-black
dependencies.description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-jedi
dependencies.description: An autocompletion tool for Python that can be used for text editors.

dependencies.name: py-pexpect
dependencies.description: Pexpect allows easy control of interactive console applications.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-prompt-toolkit
dependencies.description: Library for building powerful interactive command lines in Python

dependencies.name: py-pygments
dependencies.description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-simplegeneric
dependencies.description:
Simple generic functions (similar to Python's own len(), pickle.dump(),
etc.)

dependencies.name: py-stack-data
dependencies.description:
Extract data from python stack frames and tracebacks for informative
displays.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependent_to.name: py-line-profiler
dependent_to.description: Line-by-line profiler.

dependent_to.name: py-ipyparallel
dependent_to.description: IPython's architecture for parallel and distributed computing.

dependent_to.name: py-jupyter-console
dependent_to.description: Jupyter Terminal Console

dependent_to.name: py-black
dependent_to.description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: py-pyinstrument
dependent_to.description: Call stack profiler for Python. Shows you why your code is slow!

dependent_to.name: py-ipywidgets
dependent_to.description: IPython widgets for the Jupyter Notebook

dependent_to.name: py-spatialist
dependent_to.description:
This package offers functionalities for user-friendly geo data
processing using GDAL and OGR.

dependent_to.name: py-pytecplot
dependent_to.description:
The pytecplot library is a high level API that connects your Python
script to the power of the Tecplot 360 visualization engine. It offers
line plotting, 2D and 3D surface plots in a variety of formats, and 3D
volumetric visualization. Familiarity with Tecplot 360 and the Tecplot
360 macro language is helpful, but not required.

dependent_to.name: py-cufflinks
dependent_to.description:
Productivity Tools for Plotly + Pandas. This library binds the power of
plotly with the flexibility of pandas for easy plotting.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-dask-ml
dependent_to.description: Scalable Machine Learning with Dask.

dependent_to.name: py-multi-imbalance
dependent_to.description:
Multi-class imbalance is a common problem occurring in real-world
supervised classifications tasks. While there has already been some
research on the specialized methods aiming to tackle that challenging
problem, most of them still lack coherent Python implementation that is
simple, intuitive and easy to use. multi-imbalance is a python package
tackling the problem of multi-class imbalanced datasets in machine
learnin

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
OpenMC is a community-developed Monte Carlo neutron and photon transport
simulation code. It is capable of performing fixed source, k-eigenvalue,
and subcritical multiplication calculations on models built using either
a constructive solid geometry or CAD representation. OpenMC supports
both continuous-energy and multigroup transport. The continuous-energy
particle interaction data is based on a native HDF5 format that can be
generated from ACE files produced by NJOY. Parallelism is enabled via a
hybrid MPI and OpenMP programming model.

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-ipython-cluster-helper
dependent_to.description:
Quickly and easily parallelize Python functions using IPython on a
cluster, supporting multiple schedulers. Optimizes IPython defaults to
handle larger clusters and simultaneous processes.

dependent_to.name: spack
dependent_to.description:
Spack is a multi-platform package manager that builds and installs
multiple versions and configurations of software. It works on Linux,
macOS, and many supercomputers. Spack is non-destructive: installing a
new version of a package does not break existing installations, so many
configurations of the same package can coexist.

dependent_to.name: py-jupyterlab
dependent_to.description:
JupyterLab is the next-generation web-based user interface for Project
Jupyter.

dependent_to.name: py-ipympl
dependent_to.description: Matplotlib Jupyter Extension.

dependent_to.name: yade
dependent_to.description: Yade is an free software for particle based simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-ipykernel
dependent_to.description: IPython Kernel for Jupyter

dependent_to.name: py-nbqa
dependent_to.description: Run any standard Python code quality tool on a Jupyter Notebook.

dependent_to.name: py-ipdb
dependent_to.description:
ipdb is the iPython debugger and has many additional features, including
a better interactive debugging experience via colorized output.
